pullrequest.title: In conda 4.6.11, CONDA_PYTHON_EXE does not exist. Modify to use CONDA_EXE instead.

content.raw:
So I think it would be good to merge this quickly so that new installers \(aka possibly my thesis examiners\) can make it work!

Issues I can see:

* If `conda_exe` is `None`, then the error message the installer prints will break because `version` is not defined.
* There are probably issues with people manually adding anaconda Python to their PATH on windows, but I think these are bigger than this fix, so probably not worth trying to handle here \(maybe we just need an extra line in the installation instructions for Windows users telling people to use “anaconda prompt” rather than the Windows terminal\)
